intro: Sulitra pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sulitra, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, Sulitra pubescens is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
